segment.source: PC Keyboard Braille Input for NVDA
segment.target: PC Keyboard Braille Input for NVDA

segment.source: Author: NV Access Limited, Noelia Ruiz Martínez
segment.target: Author: NV Access Limited, Noelia Ruiz Martínez

segment.source: Copyright: 2012-2023 NV Access Limited, Noelia Ruiz Martínez
segment.target: Copyright: 2012-2023 NV Access Limited, Noelia Ruiz Martínez

segment.source: License: GNU General Public License version 2.0
segment.target: License: GNU General Public License version 2.0

segment.source: This NVDA add-on allows braille to be entered via the PC keyboard.
segment.target: This NVDA add-on allows braille to be entered via the PC keyboard.

segment.source: Currently, the following keyboard layouts are supported:
segment.target: Currently, the following keyboard layouts are supported:

segment.source: English QWERTY keyboard.
segment.target: English QWERTY keyboard.

segment.source: French (France).
segment.target: French (France).

segment.source: German (Germany).
segment.target: German (Germany).

segment.source: Italian (Italy).
segment.target: Italian (Italy).

segment.source: Persian.
segment.target: Persian.

segment.source: Portuguese (Portugal).
segment.target: Portuguese (Portugal).

segment.source: Spanish (Spain and Mexico).
segment.target: Spanish (Spain and Mexico).

segment.source: Turkish.
segment.target: Turkish.

segment.source: How to configure
segment.target: How to configure

segment.source: The add-on can be configured from its category in the NVDA's settings dialog, under NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu. A gesture for opening the add-on settings panel can be assigned from Input gestures dialog, configuration category.
segment.target: The add-on can be configured from its category in the NVDA's settings dialog, under NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu. A gesture for opening the add-on settings panel can be assigned from Input gestures dialog, configuration category.

segment.source: Check the corresponding checkbox if you want to type using only one hand, or ensure it's not checked if you prefer to type using the standard mode (two hands).
segment.target: Check the corresponding checkbox if you want to type using only one hand, or ensure it's not checked if you prefer to type using the standard mode (two hands).

segment.source: You can also select if NVDA should speak a single typed dot (using )the feature of "one hand mode").
segment.target: You can also select if NVDA should speak a single typed dot (using )the feature of "one hand mode").

segment.source: If you want dots to be sent automatically when typing with one hand, use the spin control to set a timeout greater than 0.
segment.target: If you want dots to be sent automatically when typing with one hand, use the spin control to set a timeout greater than 0.

segment.source: In addition, you can set the characters to send, clear and compose dots when typing with one hand, as well as characters to be ignored in one hand or standard mode.
segment.target: In addition, you can set the characters to send, clear and compose dots when typing with one hand, as well as characters to be ignored in one hand or standard mode.

segment.source: It's also possible to restore defaults in the add-on settings panel.
segment.target: It's also possible to restore defaults in the add-on settings panel.

segment.source: How to Use
segment.target: How to Use

segment.source: Press NVDA+0 to enable braille input. This gesture can be changed from Input gestures dialog, Braille category.
segment.target: Press NVDA+0 to enable braille input. This gesture can be changed from Input gestures dialog, Braille category.

segment.source: Type braille by pressing keys together on the PC keyboard as if it were a braille keyboard.
segment.target: Type braille by pressing keys together on the PC keyboard as if it were a braille keyboard.

segment.source: If you want to enter text using two hands, use the following keys if you work with a QWERTY English keyboard, or the keys located at the corresponding positions in other layouts:
segment.target: If you want to enter text using two hands, use the following keys if you work with a QWERTY English keyboard, or the keys located at the corresponding positions in other layouts:

segment.source: f, d and s for dots 1, 2 and 3 respectively.
segment.target: f, d and s for dots 1, 2 and 3 respectively.

segment.source: j, k and l for dots 4, 5 and 6 respectively.
segment.target: j, k and l for dots 4, 5 and 6 respectively.

segment.source: Use the keys a and ; (semi-colon) for dots 7 and 8, respectively.
segment.target: Use the keys a and ; (semi-colon) for dots 7 and 8, respectively.

segment.source: You can also use the keys on the row above; i.e. q, w, e, r, u, i, o and p.
segment.target: You can also use the keys on the row above; i.e. q, w, e, r, u, i, o and p.

segment.source: If you want to type text using one hand, you can compose characters pressing keys simultaneously or in several keystrokes, adding the dots corresponding to the desired character. Press g or h to type the character when you have added all its dots. If you make a mistake building a character, you can clear the dots before typing it by pressing t or y. The keys used in QWERTY English keyboard are the following:
segment.target: If you want to type text using one hand, you can compose characters pressing keys simultaneously or in several keystrokes, adding the dots corresponding to the desired character. Press g or h to type the character when you have added all its dots. If you make a mistake building a character, you can clear the dots before typing it by pressing t or y. The keys used in QWERTY English keyboard are the following:

segment.source: Left hand: f, d, s, r, e, w, a, q for dots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.
segment.target: Left hand: f, d, s, r, e, w, a, q for dots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.

segment.source: Right hand: j, k, l, u, i, o, ; (semicolon), p for dots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.
segment.target: Right hand: j, k, l, u, i, o, ; (semicolon), p for dots 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8.

segment.source: You can press most other keys as normal, including space, backspace, enter and function keys. Take care about not pressing alt+shift, since changing the keyboard layout may affect the entered dots.
segment.target: You can press most other keys as normal, including space, backspace, enter and function keys. Take care about not pressing alt+shift, since changing the keyboard layout may affect the entered dots.

segment.source: Press space bar in combination with braille dots to move the system cursor (or report the current line), just if you were using a braille display. For example, space+dot1 to emulate upArrow, space+dot4+dot5+dot6 to emulate control+end, space+dot1+dot4 to report the current line, etc.
segment.target: Press space bar in combination with braille dots to move the system cursor (or report the current line), just if you were using a braille display. For example, space+dot1 to emulate upArrow, space+dot4+dot5+dot6 to emulate control+end, space+dot1+dot4 to report the current line, etc.

segment.source: Press NVDA+0 to disable braille input.
segment.target: Press NVDA+0 to disable braille input.

segment.source: Important Notes
segment.target: Important Notes

segment.source: This add-on uses NVDA's in-built braille input support.
segment.target: This add-on uses NVDA's in-built braille input support.

segment.source: Therefore, the input table used is that specified in NVDA's Braille Settings dialog.
segment.target: Therefore, the input table used is that specified in NVDA's Braille Settings dialog.

segment.source: Some keyboards, particularly laptop keyboards, cannot handle certain combinations of keys being pressed.
segment.target: Some keyboards, particularly laptop keyboards, cannot handle certain combinations of keys being pressed.

segment.source: When this happens, certain keys are simply ignored.
segment.target: When this happens, certain keys are simply ignored.

segment.source: Unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done to fix this, as the keys are simply never received by Windows or NVDA.
segment.target: Unfortunately, there is nothing that can be done to fix this, as the keys are simply never received by Windows or NVDA.

segment.source: In some cases, using the upper row of keys with either or both hands might help, as your keyboard may allow these keys.
segment.target: In some cases, using the upper row of keys with either or both hands might help, as your keyboard may allow these keys.

segment.source: Changes for 44.0.0
segment.target: Changes for 44.0.0

segment.source: Added kannada.cti table.
segment.target: Added kannada.cti table.

segment.source: Changes for 28.0.0
segment.target: Changes for 28.0.0

segment.source: Changed default values for One hand mode.
segment.target: Changed default values for One hand mode.

segment.source: Changes for 2023.02.23
segment.target: Changes for 2023.02.23

segment.source: Added ability to configure keys used to type dots in one hand mode.
segment.target: Added ability to configure keys used to type dots in one hand mode.

segment.source: Now you can configure keys that should be ignored when typing in braille.
segment.target: Now you can configure keys that should be ignored when typing in braille.

segment.source: A restore to defaults button has been added to the add-on settings panel.
segment.target: A restore to defaults button has been added to the add-on settings panel.

segment.source: Compatible with NVDA 2023.1.
segment.target: Compatible with NVDA 2023.1.

segment.source: Changes for 2022.1
segment.target: Changes for 2022.1

segment.source: Added ability to configure keys to send and clear dots when writing with one hand. Also, it's possible to set a timeout to send dots automatically, without pressing confirmation keys.
segment.target: Added ability to configure keys to send and clear dots when writing with one hand. Also, it's possible to set a timeout to send dots automatically, without pressing confirmation keys.

segment.source: Changes for 2021.1
segment.target: Changes for 2021.1

segment.source: NVDA won't try to speak dots when One hand mode is not active or if space has been pressed.
segment.target: NVDA won't try to speak dots when One hand mode is not active or if space has been pressed.

segment.source: Compatible with NVDA 2021.1.
segment.target: Compatible with NVDA 2021.1.

segment.source: Changes for 2020.1
segment.target: Changes for 2020.1

segment.source: You can press space bar in combination with braille dots to emulate gestures, similar to commands available in braille displays.
segment.target: You can press space bar in combination with braille dots to emulate gestures, similar to commands available in braille displays.

segment.source: Added an option to speak single dots typed in one hand mode.
segment.target: Added an option to speak single dots typed in one hand mode.
